DATA_CMD_NONE

public static final int DATA_CMD_NONE
The following constants are setup as flags but are most often used as enumerations. We use powers of two to allow them to be used either as enums or as flags.

matchesDataCmdCondition

public boolean matchesDataCmdCondition(int dataCmdCondition)
Check the dataCmdCondition against each available data command and see if it's set in the condition; if the data command is set in the condition, then check to see if our data command for that command id is set. If any of the data commands in dataCommandCondition match our current dataCmd, return true.

getLogId

public java.lang.String getLogId()
Returns a string useful for displaying a unique Id for this DialogContext in a log or monitor file.

importFromXml

public void importFromXml(org.w3c.dom.Element parent)
Using a Document or element that was serialized using the exportToXml method in this class, reconstruct the DialogFieldStates hash map. This is basically a data deserialization method.

exportToXml

public void exportToXml(org.w3c.dom.Element parent)
Export all the data in DialogFieldStates hash map into an XML document for later retrieval. This is basically a data serialization method.

assignFieldValues

public void assignFieldValues(java.util.Map values)
Given a map of values, assign the value to each field. Each key in the map is a case-sensitive field name (should be the same fully qualified name as the field) and the value is either a String[] or an Object. If the value is an Object, then the toString() method will be called on the object to get a single value. If the value is a String[] then the assignment will be made directly (by reference).
